## Discussion

Use this class to access information about a named joint, such as its index in a skeleton’s array of joints, or its position on the screen or in the physical environment.

When you’re tracking a body in 2D space, you get the screen-space position of a named joint by using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton2D/landmark(for:)] function.

When you’re tracking a body in 3D space, you get a named joint’s position in either local or model space by using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/localTransform(for:)] or [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/modelTransform(for:)] functions, respectively.

# ARSkeleton.JointName

**Structure**

A name identifier for a joint.

## Declaration

```swift
struct JointName
```

## Discussion

Use this class to access information about a named joint, such as its index in a skeleton’s array of joints, or its position on the screen or in the physical environment.

When you’re tracking a body in 2D space, you get the screen-space position of a named joint by using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton2D/landmark(for:)] function.

When you’re tracking a body in 3D space, you get a named joint’s position in either local or model space by using the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/localTransform(for:)] or [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSkeleton3D/modelTransform(for:)] functions, respectively.

## Creating a Joint Name

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a new joint name.
- **init(_:)**: Returns a joint name that corresponds to a key point defined in a human body pose.
- **VNRecognizedPointKey**: The data type for all recognized point keys.

## Identifying Joints

- **root**: A skeletal joint that’s the root of all other joints.
- **head**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the head.
- **leftFoot**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left foot.
- **leftHand**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left hand.
- **leftShoulder**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the left shoulder.
- **rightFoot**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right foot.
- **rightHand**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right hand.
- **rightShoulder**: A skeletal joint that ARKit tracks representing the right shoulder.

## Getting Joint Information

- **definition**: The particular configuration of joints that define a body’s current state.
- **isJointTracked(_:)**: Tells you whether ARKit tracks a joint at a particular index.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
